greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of a constant associated with self-generating continued fractions and Cahen's constant.
comment: This constant is known to be transcendental.
reference: Steven R. Finch, Mathematical Constants, Cambridge University Press, 2003, Section 6.7, p. 435.
link: M. E. Cahen, Note sur un développement des quantités numériques, qui présente quelque analogie avec celui en fractions continues. In French.
J. L. Davison and J. O. Shallit, Continued Fractions for Some Alternating Series.
mathematica: digits = 100; Clear[q, s]; q[n_] := q[n] = q[n - 2]*(q[n-1] + 1); q[0] = q[1] = 1; s[k_] := s[k] = Sum[(-1)^j/(q[j]*q[j+1]), {j, 0, k}] // N[#, digits+5]&; s[dk = 5]; s[k = 2*dk]; While[RealDigits[s[k], 10, digits] != RealDigits[s[k - dk], 10, digits], Print["k = ", k]; k = k + dk]; RealDigits[s[k], 10, digits] // First
results.author: _Jean-François Alcover_, May 21 2014
